definition: Dai Bingguo (1941-), a Chinese politician and professional diplomat
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
surname Bing
to grasp/to hold/to maintain
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This afternoon, State Councilor Dai Bingguo will meet with him.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午戴秉国国务委员也将会见他。

sentences.english: On the same day, Dai also held talks with Equatorial Guinea's Deputy Prime Minister Demetrio Elo Ngong Nsefumu.
sentences.chinese: 同日，戴秉国同赤几第二副总理恩东举行了会谈。

sentences.english: Dai said that the fourth round of Six-Party Talks enjoy a sound atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国说，第四轮六方会谈气氛良好。

sentences.english: Dai asked Bader to convey Chinese President Hu Jintao's regards to Obama.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国请贝德转达胡锦涛主席致奥巴马总统的问候。

sentences.english: Dai Bingguo expressed that China and Japan are the important countries in Asia and the world.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国表示，中日两国同为亚洲和世界上的重要国家。

sentences.english: I want to thank State CouncilorDai and Vice-Premier Wang for their very warm hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 感谢国务委员戴秉国和副总理王岐山非常热情的接待。

sentences.english: He held talks with Kang Sok Ju, Vice Premier of the Cabinet of North Korea during the visit.
sentences.chinese: 访问期间，戴秉国同朝鲜内阁副总理姜锡柱举行会谈。

sentences.english: Dai Bingguo forwarded a letter for President Chirac by President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 戴秉国转交了胡锦涛主席致希拉克总统的信。

sentences.english: He also complimented Dai for the work done in the last decade.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还赞扬了戴秉国过去十年来所做的工作。

definition: Li Zhaoxing (1940-), former PRC foreign minister

Sha Zukang (1947-), Chinese diplomat
Qian Qichen (1928-2017), former Chinese vice premier
Yang Jiechi (1950-), Chinese politician and diplomat, foreign minister of PRC 2007-2013
Chen Yunlin (1941-), chairman of PRC Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS) 海峽兩岸關係協會|海峡两岸关系协会[Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4] (2008-2013)
Tang Jiaxuan (1938-), politician and diplomat
Henry Kissinger (1923-), US academic and politician, Secretary of State 1973-1977
Ruan Chongwu (1933-), third governor of Hainan
PRC Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS)
pinyin: Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4

definition: Liu Yunshan (1947-), PRC politician, background in journalism in Inner Mongolia, head of the Central Propaganda Department 2002-2012
Jia Qinglin (1940-), member of the Politburo Standing Committee 2002-2012
Shen Guofang (1952-), PRC assistant minister of foreign affairs (2003-2005)
Wu Bangguo (1941-), PRC electrical engineer and politician, polituro member from 2002
Vincent C. Siew (1939-), Taiwanese diplomat and Kuomintang politician, prime minister 1997-2000, vice president 2008-2012
Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
